snippet: President Obama, in an interview with ABC News released on Wednesday, said that the differences between Democrats and Republicans on spending and taxes may be too great to reach an agreement on the budget.
abstract: President Obama, in an interview with ABC News released on Wednesday, said that the differences between Democrats and Republicans on spending and taxes may be too great to reach an agreement on the budget.

byline.original: By ANDREW SIDDONS and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

headline.main: Obama Says Budget Differences Could Be 'Too Wide' for a Deal
